/guides/agents-guide/.s: This file follows the [agents.md](https://agents.md/) specification for AI agent context. If you're a human reading this, it provides a comprehensive overview of the Synclets project for AI assistants working with the codebase.

/guides/releases/.s: This is a reverse chronological list of the major Synclets releases, with highlighted features.

/guides/the-basics/core-concepts/.s: Before getting started with Synclets, it's helpful to understand a few core concepts that underpin how it all works.

/guides/the-basics/getting-started/.s: This will be an introductory guide to using Synclets in your application.

/guides/the-basics/.s: These guides cover the very basics of Synclets.

/guides/.s: This series of guides helps explain the concepts behind Synclets and is designed to complement the more comprehensive [API documentation](/api/synclets/).

/api/the-essentials/configuring-a-syncle.s: The createSynclet function wires the provided components, implementations, and options into a fully configured Synclet instance.
The createDataConnector function creates a custom DataConnector instance from the provided implementation callbacks.
The createMetaConnector function creates a custom MetaConnector instance from the provided implementation callbacks.
The createTransport function creates a custom Transport instance from the provided implementation callbacks.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/synclet/me.s: The getDataConnector method returns the active data connector instance.
The getMetaConnector method returns the active meta connector instance.
The getTransport method returns the transports used for messaging.

The getData method asynchronously retrieves a read-only snapshot of the complete data tree. The returned object is frozen and cannot be modified. This method uses the getData optimization if the data connector provides it, otherwise it constructs the tree by reading individual Atoms.

The getMeta method asynchronously retrieves a read-only snapshot of the complete metadata tree. The returned object is frozen and cannot be modified. This method uses the getMeta optimization if the meta connector provides it, otherwise it constructs the tree by reading individual Timestamps.

The destroy method permanently shuts down the Synclet by disconnecting all connectors and transports, then releasing all owned resources. After calling destroy(), the Synclet instance cannot be restarted and should be discarded.
The isStarted method reports whether the synclet is currently running.

The start method activates the Synclet by connecting its data and meta connectors, attaching transports, and beginning message processing. This method must be called before performing sync operations. It invokes the optional onStart implementation callback if provided.

The stop method pauses the Synclet by halting connector activity and suspending message processing. The Synclet can be restarted later with start(). This method does not destroy the Synclet or release its resources. It invokes the optional onStop implementation callback if provided.
The log method writes synclet log entries at the requested level.

The setAtom method writes an Atom value at the specified address in the data tree. The address must match the configured depth. If the sync parameter is true (the default), the change is automatically synchronized to connected peers. Optional Context metadata can be attached to the operation. This method invokes the optional onSetAtom implementation callback after the write completes.

The delAtom method removes an Atom value at the specified address in the data tree. If the sync parameter is true (the default), the deletion is automatically synchronized to connected peers. Optional Context metadata can be attached to the operation.

The sync method manually triggers synchronization for the specified address, sending the current state to all connected peers via the configured transports. This method invokes the optional onSync implementation callback if provided. Synchronization also occurs automatically after setAtom and delAtom calls when the sync parameter is true.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/synclet/.s: The Synclet interface coordinates connectors, transports, lifecycle functions, and sync operations.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/dataconnec.s: The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The DataConnector interface defines the component that is responsible for storing Atoms.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/metaconnec.s: The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The MetaConnector interface defines the component that is responsible for storing Timestamps.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/transport/.s: The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The Transport interface defines the component that is responsible for sending and receiving packets to and from other Synclets.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createsyncl.s: The createSynclet function wires the provided components, implementations, and options into a fully configured Synclet instance.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createdatac.s: The createDataConnector function creates a custom DataConnector instance from the provided implementation callbacks.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createmetac.s: The createMetaConnector function creates a custom MetaConnector instance from the provided implementation callbacks.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createtrans.s: The createTransport function creates a custom Transport instance from the provided implementation callbacks.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/synclet/syncl.s: The SyncletImplementations type collects optional async callback functions that customize Synclet behavior at key lifecycle and operational points.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/dataconnector.s: The DataConnectorImplementations type lists the async functions required to read and write Atoms.
The DataConnectorOptimizations type lists optional bulk operations a connector can implement to improve performance.
The DataConnectorOptions type describes the base options for creating a data connector.

The Atom type enumerates the primitive scalar values that can be stored at leaf addresses in the data tree: string, number, boolean, null, or the special UNDEFINED constant (used to represent JavaScript's undefined). Complex objects and arrays cannot be stored directly as Atoms and must be decomposed into scalar values.
The Atoms type maps the final part of an address to individual Atom values.
The Data type represents the recursive tree of Atoms and nested maps that make up Synclet data.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/metaconnector.s: The MetaConnectorImplementations type lists the async functions required to read and write Timestamps.
The MetaConnectorOptimizations type lists optional bulk operations a connector can implement to improve performance.
The MetaConnectorOptions type describes the base options for creating a meta connector.
The Meta type mirrors the data tree but holds Timestamp information instead of Atoms.

The Timestamp type represents a serialized Hybrid Logical Clock (HLC) value stored as a string. Timestamps are used for conflict resolution during sync, with later timestamps winning over earlier ones. The HLC format combines physical time with a logical counter to provide total ordering even when system clocks are not perfectly synchronized.
The Timestamps type maps the final part of an address to individual Timestamp values.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/transport/tra.s: The TransportImplementations type lists the async connect, disconnect, and sendPacket callbacks a Transport requires to operate.
The TransportOptions type configures transport behaviors such as fragment sizes.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/addre.s: The Address type represents an array of string segments that form a path to a specific location within the data or metadata tree. For example, ['users', '123', 'name'] addresses the 'name' atom nested under user '123'. The length of the address must match the configured tree depth.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/anyad.s: The AnyAddress type unifies all Atom, Timestamp, and parent addresses a Synclet can reference.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/anypa.s: The AnyParentAddress type covers every location that has children (whether Atoms, Timestamps, or other parent nodes).

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/atoma.s: The AtomAddress type narrows an Address to a leaf that stores an Atom at a fixed depth in a data tree.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/atoms.s: The AtomsAddress type targets the parent location that contains a collection of Atoms in a data tree.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/times.s: The TimestampAddress type narrows an Address to the leaf that stores a Timestamp at a fixed depth in a meta tree.
The TimestampsAddress type targets the parent node that contains a collection of Timestamps in a meta tree.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/component/syn.s: The SyncletComponents type bundles the optional connector and transport instances supplied to createSynclet.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/constant/rese.s: The Reserved type captures the literal string form of the RESERVED magic string.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/constant/unde.s: The Undefined type reflects the literal string produced by the UNDEFINED magic string.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/context/conte.s: The Context type holds arbitrary key-value metadata that accompanies sync messages and mutation operations. Context values must be Atoms (strings, numbers, booleans, null, or UNDEFINED). Common uses include authentication tokens, user identifiers, request IDs, or any other information needed for authorization, routing, or auditing.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/core/extramet.s: The ExtraMethods type stores host-provided helper functions keyed by name for connector implementations.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/logging/logle.s: The LogLevel type lists the logger methods that can be invoked.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/logging/logge.s: The Logger type describes the optional logging functions a Synclet or its components can use.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/message/hash/.s: The Hash type records the numeric hash used for message verification.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/message/messa.s: The Message type defines the wire-format tuple describing a sync event and its payload.
The MessageNode type represents either a Timestamp, a Timestamp-Atom pair, a hash, or nested message nodes.
The MessageNodes type stores a tuple of child message nodes plus an optional partial marker.
The MessageType type enumerates the allowed message kinds, currently the single value 0.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/message/times.s: The TimestampAndAtom type pairs a Timestamp with the optional Atom value it describes.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/option/syncle.s: The SyncletOptions type configures identifiers and logging for a Synclet instance.

/api/synclets/variables/constant/reserve.s: The RESERVED constant is a magic string used to prefix system-reserved identifiers.

/api/synclets/variables/constant/undefin.s: The UNDEFINED constant is a magic string that encodes an `undefined` value.

/api/synclets/.s: The synclets module documents the core Synclet types, helpers, and factory functions.

/api/utils/functions/utility/gethash/.s: The getHash function produces a Hash for a given string payload.

/api/utils/functions/utility/getpacketfr.s: The getPacketFromParts function encodes a destination and body into a packet string.

/api/utils/functions/utility/getpartsfro.s: The getPartsFromPacket function splits a packet into the destination and body parts.

/api/utils/functions/utility/getuniqueid.s: The getUniqueId function generates a unique ID string of the requested length.

/api/utils/functions/utility/isatom/.s: The isAtom function is a type guard that identifies Atom values.

/api/utils/functions/utility/istimestamp.s: The isTimestamp function is a type guard that identifies Timestamp values.

/api/utils/functions/utility/jsonparse/.s: The jsonParse function parses a JSON string that may have come from jsonString.

/api/utils/functions/utility/jsonstring/.s: The jsonString function converts an unknown value to a normalized JSON string.

/api/utils/.s: The utils module gathers shared helper types for JSON parsing, hashing, and packet encoding.

/api/browser/interfaces/transport/broadc.s: The getChannelName method returns the name of the wrapped BroadcastChannel.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The BroadcastChannelTransport interface describes a Transport that proxies an existing BroadcastChannel.

/api/browser/interfaces/connector/locals.s: The getStorageName method returns the localStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The LocalStorageDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector backed by localStorage.

/api/browser/interfaces/connector/sessio.s: The getStorageName method returns the sessionStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The SessionStorageDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector backed by sessionStorage.

/api/browser/interfaces/connector/locals.s: The getStorageName method returns the localStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The LocalStorageMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector backed by localStorage.

/api/browser/interfaces/connector/sessio.s: The getStorageName method returns the sessionStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The SessionStorageMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector backed by sessionStorage.

/api/browser/functions/synclet/createloc.s: The createLocalStorageSynclet function creates a complete Synclet with localStorage-backed data and meta connectors in a single call.

/api/browser/functions/synclet/createses.s: The createSessionStorageSynclet function creates a complete Synclet with sessionStorage-backed data and meta connectors in a single call.

/api/browser/functions/transport/createb.s: The createBroadcastChannelTransport function wraps a BroadcastChannel in a BroadcastChannelTransport implementation.

/api/browser/functions/connector/createl.s: The createLocalStorageDataConnector function creates a DataConnector that persists Atom data in the browser's localStorage API.

/api/browser/functions/connector/creates.s: The createSessionStorageDataConnector function creates a DataConnector that persists Atom data in the browser's sessionStorage API.

/api/browser/functions/connector/createl.s: The createLocalStorageMetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector that persists Timestamp metadata in the browser's localStorage API.

/api/browser/functions/connector/creates.s: The createSessionStorageMetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector that persists Timestamp metadata in the browser's sessionStorage API.

/api/browser/type-aliases/transport/broa.s: The BroadcastChannelTransportOptions type describes the options for creating a BroadcastChannelTransport.

/api/browser/type-aliases/connector/loca.s: The LocalStorageSynclet type represents a Synclet with localStorage-backed data and metadata connectors.

/api/browser/type-aliases/connector/sess.s: The SessionStorageSynclet type represents a Synclet with sessionStorage-backed data and metadata connectors.

/api/browser/type-aliases/type/localstor.s: The LocalStorageSyncletOptions type describes the configuration options for creating a complete Synclet with localStorage-backed data and meta connectors.

/api/browser/type-aliases/type/sessionst.s: The SessionStorageSyncletOptions type describes the configuration options for creating a complete Synclet with sessionStorage-backed data and meta connectors.

/api/browser/type-aliases/type/localstor.s: The LocalStorageDataConnectorOptions type describes the configuration options for creating a localStorage-backed DataConnector.

/api/browser/type-aliases/type/sessionst.s: The SessionStorageDataConnectorOptions type describes the configuration options for creating a sessionStorage-backed DataConnector.

/api/browser/type-aliases/type/localstor.s: The LocalStorageMetaConnectorOptions type describes the configuration options for creating a localStorage-backed MetaConnector.

/api/browser/type-aliases/type/sessionst.s: The SessionStorageMetaConnectorOptions type describes the configuration options for creating a sessionStorage-backed MetaConnector.

/api/browser/.s: The browser module covers LocalStorage, SessionStorage connectors, and BroadcastChannel transport for browser environments.

/api/database/functions/function/getquer.s: The getQuery function constructs a string and args pair for retrieving data.

/api/database/functions/function/sql/.s: The sql template tag constructs a Sql object from a template string.

/api/database/type-aliases/option/databa.s: The DatabaseDataConnectorOptions type configures the table and column names used for data storage in a database.
The DatabaseMetaConnectorConnectorOptions type configures the table and column names used for metadata storage in a database.

/api/database/type-aliases/type/sql/.s: The Sql type represents a parameterized SQL query.

/api/database/type-aliases/type/tablesch.s: The TableSchema type represents the schema of a database table as an object mapping column names to their data types.

/api/database/.s: The database module defines shared option types for SQL-style connectors.

/api/durable-object/interfaces/type/dura.s: The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
Gets the Durable Object instance associated with this transport.
A branding property to uniquely identify this as a DurableObjectTransport.
The DurableObjectTransport type represents a transport that is specialized for use with a Cloudflare Durable Object.

/api/durable-object/classes/class/syncle.s: The constructor initializes the Durable Object.
The getDataConnector method returns the data connector.
The getMetaConnector method returns the meta connector.
The getTransport method returns the transport instances.
The isStarted method returns whether the Synclet is currently started.
The getCreateComponents method can optionally be implemented to provide components for creating the Synclet, including data and meta connectors.
The getCreateImplementations method can optionally be implemented to provide custom implementations for Synclet lifecycle hooks, conflict resolution, and other behaviors.
The getCreateOptions method can optionally be implemented to provide additional options for the Synclet, such as logging configuration.
The getData method returns a readonly view of all data.
The getMeta method returns a readonly view of all metadata.
The setAtom method sets an atom value at the specified address.
The delAtom method deletes an atom at the specified address.
The destroy method destroys the Synclet and cleans up resources.

The fetch method handles incoming requests to the Durable Object. The Synclet is automatically initialized on first request if not already initialized. Override this method to implement custom request handling.
The start method starts the Synclet and begins synchronization.
The stop method stops the Synclet and pauses synchronization.
The log method logs a message at the specified level.
The sync method triggers synchronization at the specified address.
The SyncletDurableObject class is an abstract base class for creating Synclet-powered Durable Objects.

/api/durable-object/classes/class/broker.s: The constructor initializes the Durable Object.
The getDataConnector method returns the data connector.
The getMetaConnector method returns the meta connector.
The getTransport method returns the transport instances.
The isStarted method returns whether the Synclet is currently started.
The getCreateComponents method can optionally be implemented to provide components for creating the Synclet, including data and meta connectors.
The getCreateImplementations method can optionally be implemented to provide custom implementations for Synclet lifecycle hooks, conflict resolution, and other behaviors.
The getCreateOptions method can optionally be implemented to provide additional options for the Synclet, such as logging configuration.
The getData method returns a readonly view of all data.
The getMeta method returns a readonly view of all metadata.
The setAtom method sets an atom value at the specified address.
The delAtom method deletes an atom at the specified address.
The destroy method destroys the Synclet and cleans up resources.

The fetch method handles incoming requests to the Durable Object. The Synclet is automatically initialized on first request if not already initialized. Override this method to implement custom request handling.
The start method starts the Synclet and begins synchronization.
The stop method stops the Synclet and pauses synchronization.
The log method logs a message at the specified level.
The sync method triggers synchronization at the specified address.
The BrokerOnlyDurableObject class is a convenience class for creating stateless Synclet-powered Durable Objects that act as brokers for multiple WebSocket clients.

/api/durable-object/functions/creation/g.s: The getSyncletDurableObjectFetch function returns a convenient handler for a Cloudflare worker to route requests to the fetch handler of a SyncletDurableObject for the given namespace.

/api/durable-object/functions/function/c.s: The createDurableObjectSqliteDataConnector function creates a data connector that uses Cloudflare Durable Object's built-in SQLite storage.
The createDurableObjectSqliteMetaConnector function creates a meta connector that uses Cloudflare Durable Object's built-in SQLite storage.
The createDurableObjectBrokerTransport function creates a transport for brokering WebSocket messages within a Cloudflare Durable Object.

/api/durable-object/functions/utility/ge.s: The getTableSchema function retrieves the schema of a table from a Cloudflare Durable Object SQL Storage, returning an object mapping column names to their data types.

/api/durable-object/type-aliases/type/du.s: The DurableObjectSqliteDataConnector type represents a data connector that uses Cloudflare Durable Object's built-in SQLite storage.
The DurableObjectSqliteDataConnectorOptions type describes the options for creating a data connector that uses Cloudflare Durable Object's built-in SQLite storage.
The DurableObjectSqliteMetaConnector type represents a meta connector that uses Cloudflare Durable Object's built-in SQLite storage.
The DurableObjectSqliteMetaConnectorOptions type describes the options for creating a meta connector that uses Cloudflare Durable Object's built-in SQLite storage.
The DurableObjectBrokerTransport type represents a transport that enables WebSocket-based message brokering within a Cloudflare Durable Object.
The DurableObjectBrokerTransportOptions type describes the options for creating a broker transport for Cloudflare Durable Objects.
The DurableObjectTransportOptions type describes the options for creating a broker transport for Cloudflare Durable Objects.

/api/durable-object/.s: The durable-object module provides transport layer integration for Cloudflare Durable Objects.

/api/fs/interfaces/connector/directoryda.s: The getDirectory method returns the directory containing data files.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The DirectoryDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that stores data in a directory.

/api/fs/interfaces/connector/filedatacon.s: The getFile method returns the path to the backing data file.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The FileDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector backed by a single file.

/api/fs/interfaces/connector/directoryme.s: The getDirectory method returns the directory containing metadata files.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The DirectoryMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector that stores metadata in a directory.

/api/fs/interfaces/connector/filemetacon.s: The getFile method returns the path to the backing metadata file.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The FileMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector backed by a single file.

/api/fs/functions/connector/createdirect.s: The createDirectorySynclet function creates a directory-backed Synclet with both data and metadata persistence in a single call.

/api/fs/functions/connector/createfilesy.s: The createFileSynclet function creates a file-backed Synclet with both data and metadata persistence in a single call.

/api/fs/functions/connector/createdirect.s: The createDirectoryDataConnector function creates a DataConnector that persists Atom data across multiple individual files within a directory.

/api/fs/functions/connector/createfileda.s: The createFileDataConnector function creates a DataConnector that persists Atom data in a single JSON file on the file system.

/api/fs/functions/connector/createdirect.s: The createDirectoryMetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector that persists Timestamp metadata across multiple individual files within a directory.

/api/fs/functions/connector/createfileme.s: The createFileMetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector that persists Timestamp metadata in a single JSON file on the file system.

/api/fs/type-aliases/connector/directory.s: The DirectorySynclet type represents a Synclet with directory-backed data and metadata connectors.
The DirectorySyncletOptions type specifies configuration for creating a directory-backed Synclet.

/api/fs/type-aliases/connector/filesyncl.s: The FileSynclet type represents a Synclet with file-backed data and metadata connectors.
The FileSyncletOptions type specifies configuration for creating a file-backed Synclet.

/api/fs/type-aliases/connector/directory.s: The DirectoryDataConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for creating a directory-backed DataConnector.

/api/fs/type-aliases/connector/filedatac.s: The FileDataConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for creating a file-backed DataConnector.

/api/fs/type-aliases/connector/directory.s: The DirectoryMetaConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for creating a directory-backed MetaConnector.

/api/fs/type-aliases/connector/filemetac.s: The FileMetaConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for creating a file-backed MetaConnector.

/api/fs/.s: The fs module documents file- and directory-backed connector types for Node environments.

/api/memory/functions/transport/createme.s: The createMemoryTransport function creates an in-process Transport that delivers packets synchronously within the same JavaScript runtime.

/api/memory/functions/connector/createme.s: The createMemorySynclet function creates an in-memory Synclet with both data and metadata storage in a single call.
The createMemoryDataConnector function creates an in-memory DataConnector that stores Atom data in a JavaScript Map.
The createMemoryMetaConnector function creates an in-memory MetaConnector that stores Timestamp metadata in a JavaScript Map.

/api/memory/type-aliases/transport/memor.s: The MemoryTransportOptions type specifies configuration for creating an in-memory Transport.

/api/memory/type-aliases/connector/memor.s: The MemorySynclet type represents a Synclet with in-memory data and metadata connectors.
The MemorySyncletOptions type specifies configuration for creating an in-memory Synclet.

/api/memory/.s: The memory module provides volatile connectors and transport for tests, demos, and ephemeral synclets.

/api/pglite/interfaces/connector/pglited.s: The getPglite method returns the underlying PGlite instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The PgliteDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that wraps a PGlite instance.

/api/pglite/interfaces/connector/pglitem.s: The getPglite method returns the underlying PGlite instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The PgliteMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector that wraps a PGlite instance.

/api/pglite/functions/connector/createpg.s: The createPgliteSynclet function creates a Synclet with PGlite-backed connectors.
The createPgliteDataConnector function creates a DataConnector that persists Atom data in a PGlite database table.
The createPgliteMetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector that persists Timestamp metadata in a PGlite database table.

/api/pglite/functions/utility/gettablesc.s: The getTableSchema function retrieves the schema of a table from a PGlite database, returning an object mapping column names to their data types.

/api/pglite/type-aliases/connector/pglit.s: The PgliteSynclet type represents a Synclet with PGlite-backed data and metadata connectors.
The PgliteSyncletOptions type specifies configuration for creating a PGlite Synclet.
The PgliteDataConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for a PGlite DataConnector.
The PgliteMetaConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for a PGlite MetaConnector.

/api/pglite/.s: The pglite module documents connectors backed by the embedded PGlite database.

/api/sqlite3/interfaces/connector/sqlite.s: The getDatabase method returns the wrapped sqlite3 Database instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The Sqlite3DataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that wraps a sqlite3 Database.
The getDatabase method returns the wrapped sqlite3 Database instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The Sqlite3MetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector that wraps a sqlite3 Database.

/api/sqlite3/functions/connector/creates.s: The createSqlite3Synclet function creates a Synclet with SQLite3-backed connectors.
The createSqlite3DataConnector function creates a DataConnector that persists Atom data in a SQLite3 database table.
The createSqlite3MetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector that persists Timestamp metadata in a SQLite3 database table.

The Sqlite3SyncletOptions type specifies configuration for creating a SQLite3 Synclet.
The Sqlite3DataConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for a SQLite3 DataConnector.
The Sqlite3MetaConnectorOptions type specifies configuration for a SQLite3 MetaConnector.

/api/sqlite3/.s: The sqlite3 module describes connectors that persist data in sqlite3.

/api/tinybase/interfaces/connector/tinyb.s: The getStore method returns the wrapped TinyBase Store.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The TinyBaseDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that wraps a TinyBase Store.

/api/tinybase/functions/connector/create.s: The createTinyBaseSynclet function creates a Synclet with a TinyBase Store for data storage and in-memory metadata storage.
The createTinyBaseDataConnector function creates a TinyBaseDataConnector from an existing Store.

/api/tinybase/type-aliases/connector/tin.s: The TinyBaseSynclet type represents a Synclet with a TinyBase Store-backed data connector and an in-memory metadata connector.
The TinyBaseSyncletOptions type specifies configuration for creating a TinyBase Synclet.

/api/tinybase/type-aliases/type/tinybase.s: The TinyBaseDataConnectorOptions type describes the configuration options for creating a TinyBase-backed DataConnector.

/api/tinybase/.s: The tinybase module describes the adapters that wrap TinyBase stores as connectors.

/api/ws/interfaces/transport/wsbrokertra.s: The getWebSocketServer method returns the wrapped WebSocketServer instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The WsBrokerTransport interface describes a Transport that creates a broker for both this synclet and others that connect over WebSockets.

/api/ws/interfaces/transport/wsclienttra.s: The getWebSocket method returns the wrapped WebSocket instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The WsClientTransport interface describes a Transport that proxies an existing WebSocket.

/api/ws/functions/transport/createwsbrok.s: The createWsBrokerTransport function wraps a WebSocketServer in a WsBrokerTransport implementation.

/api/ws/functions/transport/createwsclie.s: The createWsClientTransport function wraps a WebSocket in a WsClientTransport implementation.

/api/ws/type-aliases/transport/wsbrokert.s: The WsBrokerTransportOptions type describes additional configuration for a WsBrokerTransport.

/api/ws/type-aliases/transport/websocket.s: The WebSocketTypes type unifies browser WebSocket and ws WebSocket implementations.

/api/ws/.s: The ws module documents WebSocket-based transports and servers for browser and Node runtimes.
